1.title: The Power Glove
1.plot: In this episode, the Bearded Nerd takes a look at the Power Glove. How did two former Atari employees build the leading company in virtual reality technology? How did a toy company take an $8,000 piece of high-end technology and convert it into an $80 product for consumers' homes?

2.title: Magnavox Odyssey & Atari Pong
2.plot: In this episode, the Bearded Nerd takes a look at the Magnavox Odyssey and Atari Pong. How did Ralph Baer get inspired to create the Odyssey? Did Ralph Baer steal the idea from William Higinbotham? Did Nolan Bushnell and Allan Alcorn steal the idea from Ralph Baer? Did Allied Leisure steal the Pong circuit board from Midway? Did Midway steal the four-player Pong circuit board from Allied Leisure? Why do the final four minutes look like Guy Ritchie took over as the director?. Answers to these and other questions in this episode.

3.title: The Console Wars
3.plot: In this episode, the Bearded Nerd takes a look at the console wars involving Atari, Fairchild, Magnavox, Mattel, RCA and Coleco. Does launching first mean being the best? Why was the Atari 5200 even released? Did RCA steal the idea of interchangeable cartridges from Fairchild? How did a company go from making nuclear reactors to making bowling equipment and eventually video games? Is Ben Stein actually less boring than the Bearded Nerd?. Answers to these and other questions in this episode.

4.title: Betamax
4.plot: In this episode, the Bearded Nerd takes a look at the Sony Betamax. Was it really better quality than VHS? Why did my VCR always have to do that "tracking" thing? Should the Bearded Nerd really have compared the launch of S-VHS to the atomic bomb of the tape format wars? What is that guy doing to that balloon animal in that Betamax ad? Answers to (most) of these and other questions in this episode.

1.title: Contra
1.plot: Bearded Nerd - Episode 1: Contra. In his pilot episode, the Bearded Nerd examines the classic NES game, Contra. Can he defeat it without using the Konami Code? What is the Konami Code? And why do the aliens like to kill people with bubbles? Answers to these and other questions on the Bearded Nerd.

2.title: Pesterminator
2.plot: Bearded Nerd - Episode 2: Pesterminator. The Bearded Nerd examines the history behind Pesterminator and its creator, Color Dreams. Will the Bearded Nerd even finish the game? And will he overcome his fear of wasps to do it? Find out.

3.title: The Games of Howard Scott Warshaw
3.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines Yar's Revenge, Raiders of the Lost Ark, and E.T. Plus an interview with the man who created these games, Howard Scott Warshaw, the Silicon Valley Therapist.

4.title: The Game Genie
4.plot: Bearded Nerd - Episode 4: The Game Genie. The Bearded Nerd examines the history behind the Game Genie and the lawsuits that resulted from its creation. Will the Bearded Nerd resist the temptation to use to beat his favorite game? Find out.

5.title: Bionic Commando
5.plot: The Bearded Nerd looks at the 1987 NES classic, Bionic Commando. Is someone at Capcom trying to win a bet? Why didn't Japan want us to fight futuristic Nazi's? What is up with all the Street Fighter 2 sequels? Answers to these and other questions in this episode.

6.title: Tecmo Bowl
6.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines the history of Tecmo Bowl and its sequels. Why can Bo Jackson outrun everybody? Is the John Madden series better? Did anybody actually use the coach mode? Answers to those and more in this episode.

7.title: Light Gun Technology
7.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines light gun technology used in gaming consoles of the 1980s and 90s. Can you actually kill the dog from Duck Hunt? Was the Super Scope really a bazooka? Why did the Konami Justifier show up at a Congressional hearing? Answers to all those and more in this episode!!.

8.title: The Oregon Trail
8.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines the in-depth history of the original Oregon Trail game, the company MECC itself, and the people behind the scenes who brought this classic to life. Includes rare footage of the 1980 Apple II version of Oregon, as well as interviews with Philip Bouchard and Wayne Studder.

9.title: Tengen
9.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines the story of Tengen and their cutthroat tactics to defeat Nintendo. To what extremes would Tengen go to bypass the 10NES lockout chip? Is reverse engineering legal? Is falsifying documents and stealing patents from the Copyright Office the best move? Who actually owns Tetris? Answers to these and other questions in this episode.

10.title: The First Video Game???
10.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines what was the very first video game. What exactly defines a video game? Can anyone actually beat Nim? Did the nerds trapped in MIT's Building 20 actually turn into radioactive mutants? Answers to these and more in this episode. Includes author Tristan Donovan.

11.title: Nintendo PlayStation
11.plot: The Bearded Nerd examines what exactly the Nintendo PlayStation was and how it came about. Why did Nintendo betray Sony and publicly humiliate them at the Consumer Electronics Show? How will Sony get their revenge on Nintendo? Will Philips be spared their execution, or will Sony just kill them quickly, as a favor? Answers to these questions and more in this episode, a real life tale of Yotsuya Kaidan, as played out between major international corporations.

imdb.title: Bearded Nerd
plot: The _Bearded Nerd_ (qv) dives deep into the history into video games, the technology involved, and the people behind them in this documentary series.
